body_html: NB: if we were to allow both strings and functions, and strings would just do getattr(nn.init, name), then I think we should force users to supply a function (so instead of some_init='xavier', you'd do some_init=init.xavier). The benefits are quite obvious (think enums vs string values).
body_text: NB: if we were to allow both strings and functions, and strings would just do getattr(nn.init, name), then I think we should force users to supply a function (so instead of some_init='xavier', you'd do some_init=init.xavier). The benefits are quite obvious (think enums vs string values).
body: NB: if we were to allow both strings and functions, and strings would just do `getattr(nn.init, name)`, then I think we should force users to supply a function (so instead of `some_init='xavier'`, you'd do `some_init=init.xavier`). The benefits are quite obvious (think enums vs string values).
